content: Turning to our insurance segment investment results, total income from the portfolio was $58 million in first quarter of 2022, compared with $92 million in the first quarter of 2021, and primarily consists of net investment income on the available-for-sale portfolio, which was $63 million in the first quarter of 2022, compared with $73 million in the first quarter of 2021, and equity in earnings on alternative investments which was a small net loss in the first quarter of 2022 compared with a gain of $19 million in the first quarter of 2021.
